And everyone in Washington loves to talk about national security – I think this is a national security issue, too. 

I think we need to expand our definition of national security to include not just the strength of our military but the preparedness and success of our students.

I believe this is a moral issue – no child in America should go hungry. Period. 

But I also think this is an economic issue. Students can’t prepare for a career if they’re focused on hunger.

My sisters are both public school teachers. I hear from them all the time that when it comes to helping kids learn, healthy food is just as important as a textbook. We have millions of kids in this country who can’t concentrate because they are showing up to class hungry.

Nearly 1 in 9 children here in Massachusetts is food insecure. America is the richest country in the history of this world – yet there are 13 million kids here that deal with hunger or food insecurity.

That’s a national disgrace.
